notes: Summary: Jive Gray survives a belly landing.

7.heading: "For a Sensual Approach to Comics."
7.title: "Pour une Approche Sensuelle de la Bande Dessinée"
7.author: Pascal Lefèvre; text inédit traduit de l'anglais par Thierry Groensteen
7.appears_in: p. 8-13 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 2 (Jan. 1997).
notes: English summary (from p. 136): "For a Sensual Approach to Comics: The graphic style of an artist has considerable impact, at least unconsciously, on our perception of the story. Pascal Lefèvre argues that the sensual quality of drawings should be considered an essential vector of the emotion being proposed. He suggests that a closer, more discerning look at the line, colour and internal rhythm of an image will foster true communion between the reader and the state of mind of the artist at the moment of creation."

8.heading: For and against.

38.title: For Better or For Worse
38.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Michael's worried that Farley won't eat his food, but Ellie doesn't want to spoil him.

39.title: For Better or For Worse
39.author: by Lynn Johnston.
39.series: May 23, 1985) "What's It Called, Suffer with the Stars?"*
notes: Summary: Ellie is trying out a celebrity diet cookbook.

40.title: For Better or For Worse
40.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Michael does a dog food commercial in a play television set.

41.title: For Better or For Worse
41.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Elly complains to her mother that she's gaining weight, and Michael brings in an envelope saying it must be for her.

42.title: For Better or For Worse
42.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Ellie's helping John as a substitute dental assistant, and she's glad Phil (her brother) is the first patient because she can't remember which end of the suction goes where.

43.title: For Better or For Worse
43.author: by Lynn Johnston.
43.series: Apr. 14, 1986) "I Thought He Might Be Tired of Eating Alone"
notes: Summary: Elizabeth fills a bowl with milk and slurps it on the floor alongside Farley.

44.title: For Better or For Worse
44.author: by Lynn Johnston.
44.series: Feb. 11, 1987) "You're Suggesting That I Ask a Woman Who's Devoting Her Life to Motherhood to Come Back to Work?"*

45.title: For Better or For Worse
45.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Elizabeth let Grandma French braid her hair, and Ellie wants to know why she sat still for it.

46.title: For Better or For Worse
46.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Michael is thinking he'd like to be a dog with no chores or homework, but then he watches Farley getting fed canned dog food.

47.title: For Better or For Worse
47.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Michael has dye on his face from Halloween, and is trying to hide by pulling his sweater up.

48.title: For Better or For Worse
48.author: by Lynn Johnston.
48.series: July 1, 1988) "You Want Him to Get Fat?"*
notes: Summary: Ellie can't stand throwing food away, and Annie suggests feeding it to the dog.

49.title: For Better or For Worse
49.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: The head of the camp shows them the bulletin board, and asks if there are any questions.

50.title: For Better or For Worse
50.author: by Lynn Johnston.
50.series: Oct. 6, 1988) "I Need a New Snowsuit, Mom"*
notes: Summary: Mom groans when she realizes how much her daughter has grown.

51.title: For Better or For Worse
51.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: There's no food in the house so Michael eats dog treats.

52.title: For Better or For Worse
52.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Michael is mowing grumpily until a girl jogger comes by and he straightens up and smiles.
Wordless strip.

53.title: For Better or For Worse
53.author: by Lynn Johnston.
53.series: Mar. 17, 1990) "Maybe You Could Smile a Little"*
notes: Summary: It's top-of-the-line mutt chow, but Farley won't eat anything people won't eat. Michael tries to set a good example.

54.title: For Better or For Worse
54.author: Lynn.
54.series: Aug. 15, 1989) "Maybe You Should Mow One of the Lawns First"*
notes: Summary: It's hot out and Michael needs to have a drink and cool off.

55.title: For Better or For Worse
55.author: Lynn.
55.series: Dec. 12, 1990) "It Won't Start When It's Cold"*
notes: Summary: Michael complains to Dad about the snowblower.

56.title: For Better or For Worse
56.author: Lynn.
56.series: July 5, 1990) "I Wonder How Much You Could Make as a Lawn Ornament?"*
notes: Summary: Michael has been told he has to get a job, and he's not happy about it.

57.title: For Better or For Worse
57.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Liz snorts after Farley rejects her books and papers.

58.title: For Better or For Worse
58.author: Lynn.
58.series: July 23, 1991) "You Mean If You Shaved Off His Face, He'd Have Wrinkles?"*
notes: Summary: Elizabeth is taking Farley and riding her bike to Harrison's Pond; Elly says wait for him because he's getting old.

59.title: For Better or For Worse
59.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Mike takes off on his bike to apologize.

60.title: For Better or For Worse
60.author: [No author]
60.series: Feb. 24, 1992) "Did I Just See What I Thought I Saw?"*
notes: Summary: Farley finds a pacifier in his dog food, and walks off sucking on it.

61.title: For Better or For Worse
61.author: by Lynn Johnston.
61.series: Apr. 6, 1992) "None of These Dang Things Fits Worth A Bean"*
notes: Summary: Florence Dilbutt, the new patient, has a bag of dentures that other dentists and denturists have made for her.

62.title: For Better or For Worse
62.author: Lynn.
62.series: Sept. 12, 1992) "I'd Have a Figure to Die For"*
notes: Summary: Candace smokes to curb her appetite; it would be awesome if she could lose 10 pounds.

63.title: For Better or For Worse
63.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Michael catches Liz and a friend experimenting with smoking cigarettes.

64.title: For Better or For Worse
64.author: Lynn.
64.series: Nov. 28, 1992) "Look Your Critics Square in the Eye and Go for It. I've Been Doing It for Years"*
notes: Summary: Miss Edwards gives Dawn Enjo some advice about life from her wheelchair.

65.title: For Better or For Worse
65.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Elizabeth does her finger and toenails, and Farley adds fur to all twenty with a big shake before they're dry.

66.title: For Better or For Worse
66.author: Lynn.
66.series: Mar. 26, 1993) "I'm Probably Never Going to Get Married. Ever."*
notes: Summary: Lawrence's mom has a puppy to keep her happy until Lawrence has children, and Lawrence says the puppy better live a long time.

67.title: For Better or For Worse
67.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: In disbelief on finding out that Lawrence is gay, Michael kicks a fire hydrant and punches a stop sign, injuring himself.

68.title: For Better or For Worse
68.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Lawrence tries to reason with his mom about being gay, but she won't hear it and calls his father.

69.title: For Better or For Worse
69.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Mike finds Lawrence sitting alone at an all-night donut shop.

70.title: For Better or For Worse
70.author: by Lynn Johnston.
70.series: Apr. 19, 1993) "Is It OK If I Feel Angry For You?"*
notes: Summary: Mike says he's sorry Lawrence got thrown out because he's gay, and Lawrence says he doesn't want anybody feeling sorry for him.

71.title: For Better or For Worse
71.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Mike tells Lawrence, "You're not sick," and Lawrence says he's had 11 jelly donuts and 5 coffees.

72.title: For Better or For Worse
72.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Mike has called Lawrence's mom, and is taking Lawrence home.

73.title: For Better or For Worse
73.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Michael mows a single swath and leaves the lawnmower.

74.title: For Better or For Worse
74.author: Lynn.
74.series: Sept. 3, 1993) "Where There's a Wheel, There's a Way!"*
notes: Summary: Miss Edwards, the teacher in the wheelchair, spent the summer camping, canoeing, hiking and fishing.

75.title: For Better or For Worse
75.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Liz shows April the Snoopy calendar and tells her it's New Year's Day, and April bursts into tears.

76.title: For Better or For Worse
76.author: Lynn.
76.series: Feb. 7, 1994) "We Don't Want Another Dog in the House, John"*
notes: Summary: April is asking for a puppy for Christmas.

77.title: For Better or For Worse
77.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Miss Edwards wants to know why Elizabeth and Dawn Enjo aren't friendly anymore. Miss Edwards is shown in her wheelchair.

78.title: For Better or For Worse
78.author: Lynn.
78.series: Nov. 5, 1994) "Trust Me, April, It's Easier That Way"*
notes: Summary: Sera's new puppies have been born, and April wonder why they're so small.

79.title: For Better or For Worse
79.author: Lynn.
79.series: Nov. 8, 1994) "What Are You Looking at me like That For?"*
notes: Summary: After an explanation that Farley doesn't need to see his puppies because their care is entirely up to the mother, suddenly the whole family is looking thoughtfully at John.

80.title: For Better or For Worse
80.author: Lynn.
80.series: Jan. 8, 1996) "Now That We Have Finished Romeo and Juliet"*
notes: Summary: The teacher wants the play analyzed "from a communications point of view."

81.title: For Better or For Worse
81.author: Lynn.
81.series: Feb. 17, 1996) "I'm In! An' the Landlady's Deep in Dreamland!"*
notes: Summary: Mike's coming in late, up a tree and into an upstairs window, and Mrs. Dingle is ready to hit him with a lamp.

82.title: For Better or For Worse
82.author: Lynn.
82.series: July 9, 1997) "Too Bad We Couldn't Just Give Her Another Heart"*
notes: Summary: Ellie's mom's triple-bypass surgery is done.

83.title: For Better or For Worse
83.author: Lynn.
83.series: July 11, 1997) "This is the First Time We've Had Family Home, and I Didn't Have to Cook"*
notes: Summary: Elly's mother is in the hospital, but looking at the bright side.

84.title: For Better or For Worse
84.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: April visits Grandma Marian in the hospital, and asks her a special question.

85.title: For Better or For Worse
85.author: Lynn.
85.series: July 22, 1997) "Could You Give Mom a Bath?"*
notes: Summary: Phil and Ellie make the decision to call a home care service organization to help their mother.

86.title: For Better or For Worse
86.author: Lynn.
86.series: July 23, 1997) "Waiting for Grandma to be Discharged from the Hospital"*
notes: Summary: Ellie and April are waiting for home-care services to call.

87.heading: For Better or For Worse (July 26, 1997).
87.title: "If They Go, Where Would We Call Home?"
87.author: Lynn.
87.series: For Better or For Worse, July 26, 1997
notes: Summary: Phil and Ellie worry about their parents, now that mom's coming out of the hospital.

88.title: For Better or For Worse
88.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Mom being away creates a real empty space, especially in the refrigerator.
Key words: Missing, needs, stale pizza.

89.title: For Better or For Worse
89.author: Lynn.
89.series: July 29, 1997) "It Only Took You Two Tries"*
notes: Summary: Liz is nervous, but Michael says the final driving exam is a cinch, a no-brainer.
Key words: Twerps, bozos.

90.title: For Better or For Worse
90.author: Lynn.
90.series: July 30, 1997) "Some of these Examiners are Real Toads"*
notes: Summary: Mike's advice is to focus and pretend the arrogant driving exam guy isn't even there.
Key words: Juice, scaring, incompetence.

91.title: For Better or For Worse
91.author: by Lynn Johnston.
91.series: July 31, 1997) "The Most Important Thing is to be Observant"*
notes: Summary: Liz's driving examiner is gorgeous, with sensational eyes, a voice like a singer, no ring, and he's definitely from Quebec.
Key words: French accents, routes.

92.title: For Better or For Worse
92.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Elizabeth passes her drivers' exam with flying colors.
Key words: Skills, parallel parking.

93.title: For Better or For Worse
93.author: by Lynn Johnston.
93.series: Aug. 2, 1997) "Drove Down to the Mall an' Hung Around the Food Court"*
notes: Summary: Mike asks Elizabeth what she's going to do with the freedom of having a drivers' license, and she asks him what he did.
Key words: Womanhood, jobs, boyfriends, happening.

94.title: For Better or For Worse
94.author: Lynn.
94.series: June 13, 1998) "Tomorrow I'll Walk Him AFTER Dinner"
notes: Summary: Grandpa takes Edgar for a walk, with Edgar anticipating his dog food at home.

95.title: For Better or For Worse
95.author: Lynn.
95.series: June 25, 1998) "Animals and Little Kids. They're Always Smarter than They Look"*
notes: Summary: Edgar knows he's going somewhere he doesn't want to, and April wonders why her dad doesn't just say it's to the kennel.

96.title: For Better or For Worse
96.author: Lynn.
96.series: July 21, 1998) "No Matter What You Call It, Love is Love Until It's Over"*
notes: Summary: Michael and Liz argue about puppy love.

97.title: For Better or For Worse
97.author: Lynn.
97.series: July 29, 1998) "I'm Going to Get a Dog"*
notes: Summary: As he's leaving, Grandpa says he's planning to get a 'live-in-companion,' meaning the dog named Dixie that he eventually gets.

98.title: For Better or For Worse
98.author: Lynn.
98.series: Aug. 5, 1998) "You Don't Work This Hard To Become a Failure"*
notes: Summary: They're putting in a small coffee shop, and Mike asks Gord if he ever expected his gas station to be such a success.

99.title: For Better or For Worse
99.author: Lynn.
99.series: Sept. 4, 1998) "Some People Make You Explain Everything"*
notes: Summary: April is convinced that 'grass' is the plural of 'gra.'

100.title: For Better or For Worse
100.author: Lynn.
100.series: Sept. 22, 1998) "Never Say the Word 'Walk' When You're Leaving"*
notes: Summary: Edgar's lonesome, and bounds out the door at the promise of a walk after work.

101.title: For Better or For Worse
101.author: Lynn.
101.series: Sept. 23, 1998) "I Forgot. He Hates the Soaps"*
notes: Summary: Elly leaves Edgar home, with the TV on for company, and Edgar howls.

102.title: For Better or For Worse
102.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Elly hides doggie treats around the house to occupy Edgar so she can leave for work.

103.title: For Better or For Worse
103.author: Lynn.
103.series: Sept. 25, 1998) "He's Just a Dumb Animal who Thinks I'm His Mother!"*
notes: Summary: Elly feels guilty about leaving Edgar alone.

104.title: For Better or For Worse
104.author: Lynn.
104.series: Sept. 26, 1998) "I Thought it was Something Important"*
notes: Summary: Elizabeth is called to the office because her mom wants her to check on the dog.

105.title: For Better or For Worse
105.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Mike and Weed return to their apartment and see Mrs. Dingle watching them, though she denies it.

106.title: For Better or For Worse
106.author: Lynn.
106.series: Nov. 4, 1998) "I Bet You're Spoiling Her Like Crazy!"*
notes: Summary: Elly's dad tells her about Dixie, the Sheltie that has come to live with him.

107.title: For Better or For Worse
107.author: by Lynn Johston.
notes: Summary: Dixie kept sitting outside his door, like she knew she was going to be living there.

108.title: For Better or For Worse
108.author: Lynn.
108.series: Nov. 6, 1998) "Especially If She's Had a Lot to Drink the Night Before!"*
notes: Summary: Dixie has quite a personality, and gives Ellie's dad a reason to get up every morning.

109.title: For Better or For Worse
109.author: Lynn.
109.series: Nov. 7, 1998) "It's Taking Less Time for her to Train Me Than I Thought It Would"*
notes: Summary: Ellie's dad's new dog, Dixie, is keeping him company.

110.title: For Better or For Worse
110.author: Lynn.
110.series: Feb. 17, 1999) "This Is Going To Be A Serious and Solemn Day"*
notes: Summary: He plans a day of reflection on his 50th birthday, but when he opens the front door the yard is full of plastic flamingos.

111.title: For Better or For Worse
111.author: Lynn.
111.series: Feb. 18, 1999) "They Appeared Mysteriously in the Night"*
notes: Summary: 50 flamingos have appeared on the front lawn on his 50th birthday.

112.title: For Better or For Worse
112.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Dr. Patterson tricks his staff to find out who put the flamingos on his lawn.

113.title: For Better or For Worse
113.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Edgar and April share a piece of cake.

114.title: For Better or For Worse
114.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Connie didn't have any problem getting Greg to agree to her eye surgery, because he just bought himself custom golf clubs.

115.title: For Better or For Worse
115.author: Lynn.
115.series: June 4, 1999) "All My Life They've Had Nothing To Do With Me Because of Business"*
notes: Summary: The maid tells Josef his parents aren't home to see him because they're in Mexico on business.

116.title: For Better or For Worse
116.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Mike's down because his girlfriend is in Honduras, and Lawrence says that his mom went to Ecuador for a long time, and one the souvenirs she brought back was him.

117.title: For Better or For Worse
117.author: by Lynn Johnston.
117.series: Aug. 23, 1999) "Dad's Down on All Fours, Scratching the Dog"*
notes: Summary: Edgar is driving John crazy with his scratching.

118.title: For Better or For Worse
118.author: by Lynn Johnston.
118.series: Dec. 29, 1999) "Do You Think She'll Like It, Tracey?"*
notes: Summary: Michael has bought a ring for Deanna.

119.title: For Better or For Worse
119.author: Lynn.
119.series: Jan. 5, 2000) "Elizabeth is Trying On Deanna's Engagement Ring. That's Not Bad Luck, Is It?"*

120.title: For Better or For Worse
120.author: Lynn.
120.series: May 3, 2000) "One Crummy Note Outta Your Mouth an' You are Dog Food!"*
notes: Summary: Jeremy Jones, the bully, is caught intimidating April.

121.title: For Better or For Worse
121.author: by Lynn Johnston.
121.series: June 19, 2000) "Cars Can't Always Watch Out For You!"*
notes: Summary: April leaves on her bike, and Grampa warns her to watch for cars.

122.title: For Better or For Worse
122.author: by Lynn Johnston.
122.series: June 27, 2000) "Everybody Acted Like I Was His Friend"*
notes: Summary: The ambulance people gave Jeremy's helmet to April.

123.title: For Better or For Worse
123.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Grandpa reflects on a lifetime of thinking and good decision making.

124.title: For Better or For Worse
124.author: Lynn.
124.series: Oct. 7, 2000) "Some Gifts Come With Strings Attached"*
notes: Summary: Grandpa gives April a guitar and makes her promise to take real lessons.

125.title: For Better or For Worse
125.author: by Lynn Johnston.
125.series: Oct. 13, 2001) "You Moved It from the Heart to the Flower"*
notes: Summary: April can tell Elly's already seen her report on trees, because it's in a different place on her quilt.

126.title: For Better or For Worse
126.author: Lynn.
126.series: June 7, 2002) "In a Few Days, We'll All Be Back to Normal"*
notes: Summary: Grandpa and Dixie have moved out, and the family misses them, including Edgar who's thinking about Dixie.

127.title: For Better or For Worse
127.author: by Lynn Johnston.
127.series: Aug.2, 2003) "What Would You Like To Do When We Retire That Would Be Really Fun?"*

128.title: For Better or For Worse
128.author: Lynn.
128.series: Aug. 8, 2003) "I Wish We Had Time to Stop and Smell the Roses"*
notes: Summary: Lawrence and Nick are very busy with their landscaping business.

129.title: For Better or For Worse
129.author: by Lynn Johnston.
129.series: Aug. 9, 2003) "Deanna's at Her Mom's with the Baby, so I Thought I'd Take My Sis Out to Dine"*
notes: Summary: They stop at a hamburger stand.

130.title: For Better or For Worse
130.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Mike's being quoted all over for his story, and the subject's associates have started a class action suit.

131.title: For Better or For Worse
131.author: Lynn.
131.series: Apr. 12, 2004) "Dad Sent a Message from Mexico"*
notes: Summary: Liz and Beck are hoping the Pattersons bring them something made of silver.

132.title: For Better or For Worse
132.author: Lynn.
132.series: Apr. 14, 2004) "I Did Absolutely Nothing, and I Don't Feel Guilty at All!"*
notes: Summary: He's been reading (and ogling) on the beach, so El shouldn't feel guilty about buying things.

133.title: For Better or For Worse
133.author: by Lynn Johnston.
133.series: June 30, 2004) "Check Out the Fridge an' Yew Will Fiiiind.."*
notes: Summary: April is elated to be out of school for the Summer, then finds a job list on the refrigerator.

134.title: For Better or For Worse
134.author: Lynn.
134.series: July 2, 2004) "This Miserable Hunk of Scrap is Gonna Get Me Downtown One Way or Another!"*
notes: Summary: Liz's car won't start, and she calls a tow truck.

135.title: For Better or For Worse
135.author: Lynn.
135.series: July 3, 2004) "I've Got a Bike You Can Borrow"*
notes: Summary: Liz's car is a "toaster," and a company van won't do, so Gord offers to loan her a motorcycle.

136.title: For Better or For Worse
136.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Gord offers Liz the use of a motorcycle that was abandoned at his garage, helmet and all. All she needs to do is take the driver's test.

137.title: For Better or For Worse
137.author: Lynn.
137.series: July 6, 2004) "House Closed, Fridge Closed, Wallet Closed, Mind Closed!"*
notes: Summary: Elizabeth tells her mom about a motorcycle, and her mom is against it, though Elizabeth says she's an adult, and responsible, case closed.

138.title: For Better or For Worse
138.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Gordon offered to loan Elizabeth a motorcycle, Elly is outraged, worried about the danger, and tells John to talk to her.

139.title: For Better or For Worse
139.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: Elly doesn't want to hear about the benefits of motorcycle riding, and Liz just wants to be trusted. April chimes in.

140.title: For Better or For Worse
140.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Liz just needs to read the manual and pass the driving test to ride the motorcycle, and April is briefly excited about the prospect.

141.title: For Better or For Worse
141.author: Lynn.
notes: Summary: April's cousin Laura sounds like a grown-up with her advice about musicianship.

142.title: For Better or For Worse
142.author: by Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: April's band decides to quit.

143.title: For Better or For Worse
143.author: Lynn Johnston.
143.series: May 3, 2006) "I Dreamed That You Flew Up Into the Sky"*
notes: Summary: Jesse visits Elizabeth for cookies. In his dream she left him her stereo.

144.title: For Better or For Worse
144.author: Lynn Johnston.
144.series: May 4, 2006) "But First You Have to Find the Right Garden!"*
notes: Summary: Liz and her landlady have a talk about putting down roots.

145.title: For Better or For Worse
145.author: Lynn Johnston.
145.series: May 5, 2006) "We'd Like to Have the Rest of You"*
notes: Summary: Elizabeth hasn't signed a contract for her next year of teaching, though she says her heart is in it.

146.title: For Better or For Worse
146.author: Lynn Johnston.
146.series: May 6, 2006) "I Helped Jesse's Auntie Pull Quills from a Porcupine Skin"*
notes: Summary: Elizabeth writes a homesick e-mail to April.

147.title: For Better or For Worse
147.author: Lynn Johnston.
147.series: May 10, 2006) "Go to Sleep. You Can Feel Guilty in the Morning"*
notes: Summary: Robin has low resistance to illnesses, catches everything in day care, and his mom surprises herself by saying it's an inconvenience.

148.title: For Better or For Worse
148.author: Lynn Johnston.
148.series: May 27, 2006) "A Building Needs a Firm Foundation"*
notes: Summary: Paul has applied for a transfer to Spruce Narrows, but Elizabeth doesn't want to stay.

149.title: For Better or For Worse
149.author: Lynn Johnston.
notes: Summary: Elizabeth tries to say goodbye to Jesse, and Jesse won't talk to her.

150.title: For Better or For Worse
notes:
Newspaper comic strip by Lynn Johnston. See also individual characters

  • John Patterson
  • Michael Patterson
    and the dogs

  • Edgar
